page.title: 01TWO VILLAGES, SUSSEX WEALD
page.content: Mainly an area of mixed farming on undulating land, not more than half suitable for arable crops. East-west ridge carries the A271 road and villages of Windmill Hill and Boreham Street. Countryside north of this due to be designated area of outstanding natural beauty. Few residents now employed on the land. There are two market garden enterprises and a farm shop. Several buildings listed for preservation, two barns being converted to dwellings. New planning development very restricted. One garage runs a busy livestock haulage business. Visitors are attracted by a country house hotel,a road house and two restaurants, also residential caravan park and country house tennis centre. Two village stores with sub-post office facilties remain and one traditional public house.
